diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient presented with right lower quadrant abdominal pain that escalated in severity over two days, associated with nausea, malaise, anorexia, chills, and bloating. Physical examination revealed tenderness in the right lower quadrant and positive Rovsing's sign. A CT scan showed a fluid-filled and abnormally dilated appendix with mucosal hyperenhancement, periappendiceal fat stranding, and adjacent free fluid, confirming acute appendicitis.
